headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; Senator Wilson's Unspoken Speech on the Slave-trade. What Wigfall had to Say on the Davis Resolutions. A DESULTORY DAY IN THE HOUSE. WHERE IS MR. FOWLER? THE JAPANESE. THE MEXICAN TREATY. REPRESENTATIVE PHILANTHROPY. ARMY NEWS.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE COVODE COMMITTEE. The Covode Committee developed nothing of interest to-day. The testimong taken yesterday has been sent to the Postmaster-General, with the request that he will furnish the Committee with copies of all correspondence touching the Vanderbilt and Johnson contracts.

headline.main: FROM JAMAICA.; Tussle between the Governor and the House of Assembly--The Governor Triumphant--A National Calamity--Naval and Military--Mining Prospects--Earthquakes--Destruction of Estates by Fire--The Weather and the Crops--Public Health--The Markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: I forwarded a communication by way of St. Thomas and Havana, by the packet which left here on the 27th of February, and another by a similar opportunity on the 26th of March, but I have since been informed that these are tardy means of transit; I shall, therefore, in future, seek more expeditious modes for forwarding my correspondence.

headline.main: ITALY.; AFFAIRS IN TUSCANY. DEPARTURE OF VICTOR EMANUEL PROBABILITIES OF A ROMAN CAMPAIGN THE DECLINE OF REV. THEODORE PARKER.

docs.lead_paragraph: VICTOR EMANUEL left Florence at the beginning of the present week, and the town has returned to its usual quiet. At 4 o'clock in the morning, the loyal inhabitants heard a furious rattling of wheels and spirited cracking of postillions' whips in their streets, and they could sleep no longer, for they knew it was the train of vehicles which was bearing their King and his counselors away.

headline.main: Old School General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church.
POLICE COMMISSIONERS.; BONE-BOILING ESTABLISHMENTS AND SLAUGHTERHOUSES.

NATIONAL POLITICS.; Great Douglas Demonstration in New-York. The Union Represented at the Cooper Institute. Speeches of Hon. Francis B. Cutting, Hon. Messrs. Richardson and Logan of Illinois, Hon. Mr. Waterson and Ex-Gov. Foote of Tennessee, Hon. C. C. Marshal of Kentucky, Judge Larrabee of Wisconsin, Thomas C. Field, and others. Decided and Emphatic Pronunciamento of the Northern Democracy for the Little Giant. RESOLUTIONS, LETTERS, &c. Serenade to the Speakers at the Fifth-Avenue Hotel.

docs.snippet: Mr. DAWES, of Mass., (Rep.,) from the Committee or Elections, reported resolutions declaring first, that J.R. BARRETT is not, and secondly that FRANCIS P. BLAIR is, entitled to a seat from the First Congressional District of Missouri. The majority...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. DAWES, of Mass., (Rep.,) from the Committee or Elections, reported resolutions declaring first, that J.R. BARRETT is not, and secondly that FRANCIS P. BLAIR is, entitled to a seat from the First Congressional District of Missouri. The majority and minority reports were ordered to be printed.
